result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
FOP/DPU Contract rec'd; Contract terminates on 9/26/23

12:03 PM Defendant Sergio Garcia Gonzalez in court with Attorney Michael J. Short.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State moves to orally amend to add a 2nd count - disorderly conduct 947.01(1). No Objection by the State.

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1. 

Plea questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to Count 2 as amended.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Deferred Prosecution Program.  Bail continued. 

Abby H.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 7/22/22 to David Van Den Brandt, batch 7123.
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Michael J. Short appeared in person with Defn. Trial dates selected, NIH.
Jury trial on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Paid interpreter fees for services on 6/9/22 to Brenda Bartholomew, batch 6194.
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Br 2

01:38 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Tracy L McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Brenda B. duly sworn. Officer A. Hadgi duly sworn, direct and cross. Officer identified Defn in court. State moves for bind over, waives argument and reserves rebuttal. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC, case bound over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:45 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Jim Larson duly sworn and interpreted. Defendant has not retained counsel.   Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASH BAIL TO BE POSTED BY 2/8/2022 AT 4:00 PM OR A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards SAG-S. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:29 AM Defendant appeared.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fayme Filipiak interpreted. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances. Warrant vacated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
IA scheduled per DA

11:02 AM Defendant did not appear.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson interpreted for victim observing via livestream. All parties by Zoom. Warrant and copy of Complaint given to the Sheriff's Office to attempt to serve.
